item.title: Former PlayStation Boss Thinks Sony Needs To Focus On More Than Just Graphics
item.content:encoded:
https://www.gamespot.com/articles/former-playstation-boss-thinks-sony-needs-to-focus-on-more-than-just-graphics/1100-6530520/?ftag=CAD-01-10abi2f

GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.

From the original PlayStation through to the PS5 Pro, graphics have always played a key role in marketing that console. Former Sony president Shuhei Yoshida thinks that it might be time for Sony to start focusing on other aspects of video games so that Sony can become popular in a "broader" sense.

"Up until now, PlayStation's DNA has been driven by values ​​such as 'cutting-edge graphics' that have continued since [Ken] Kutaragi-san's time," Yoshida said to AV Watch (via a translation by Genki). "Users have also expected that from PlayStation games. However, it's about time we have to reconsider that. Of course, I think it's necessary to provide the very best--in terms of graphics quality--to those who want it. But, in order to continue to be popular with users in a broad sense, we naturally have to change our way of thinking."

The Last of Us Part II Remastered - Features Trailer

Want us to remember this setting for all your devices?

Sign up or Sign in now!

Please use a html5 video capable browser to watch videos.

This video has an invalid file format.

Sorry, but you can't access this content!

Several of Sony's first-party games are graphical showcases--with last year's The Last of Us Part 2 Remastered being a prime example--and the company has continued to push for photorealistic visuals in several of its biggest games. While games like last year's Astro Bot are an exception to the rule, Sony generally tends to favor a degree of realism with its exclusives. Meanwhile, Take-Two Interactive CEO Strauss Zelnick believes that games with live-action-like visuals aren't far away from being realized.

There are downsides to this, as games striving for realism can look dated after a few years and the cost to produce them has grown enormously. Former Sony executive Shawn Layden has said the AAA video game space is unsustainable due in part to rising development costs, and Sony is aiming to speed up its game-development process with AI and machine-learning initiatives.

Interestingly, Naughty Dog co-founder Andy Gavin recently revealed the reason why the studio sold itself to Sony back in 2001 was due to rising development costs. As Gavin explained, Naughty Dog spent about $100,000 to develop 1992's Rings of Power, $1.6 million on the first Crash Bandicoot game released in 1996, and $1.6 million on Jak and Daxter in 2001.

Darryn Bonthuys on Google+

Got a news tip or want to contact us directly? Email news@gamespot.com

item.title: Former Donkey Kong Champion Billy Mitchell Wins Defamation Case Against YouTuber
item.content:encoded:
https://www.gamespot.com/articles/former-donkey-kong-champion-billy-mitchell-wins-defamation-case-against-youtuber/1100-6530518/?ftag=CAD-01-10abi2f

GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.

For several years, former Donkey Kong and Pac-Man champion Billy Mitchell's biggest battles shifted from arcade expos to courtrooms over allegations that he cheated on some of his championship runs. Now, Mitchell has emerged victorious in an Australian court against Karl Jobst, a YouTube artist who allegedly defamed Mitchell.

Jobst has accused Mitchell of cheating numerous times, including his contention that Mitchell used an 8-way joystick for Donkey Kong in his record-breaking runs. Via The Guardian, that allegation paled in comparison to Jobst's since-retracted assertion that Mitchell drove another YouTube artist, Apollo Legend, to suicide following his legal settlement with the former champ.

Jobst's defense in court argued that Mitchell has a reputation for cheating and for suing people who made those accusations. The judge agreed with that characterization of Mitchell, but ruled that Jobst's videos had "severely damaged Mitchell's reputation and caused distress."

Following the judge's ruling, Jobst must now pay $350,000 plus interest to Mitchell. When Mitchell brought the case to the court, he asked for $400,000 in damages and $50,000 in aggravated damages.

Mitchell had previously sued Twin Galaxies to force the organization to restore his high scores. The two sides settled out of court in early 2024, and Mitchell's scores were re-added to the historical section of Twin Galaxies' site, but not the current listing of scores.

Image credit: David Greedy/Getty Images

Got a news tip or want to contact us directly? Email news@gamespot.com

item.title: Pac-Man Game Shutting Down In May
item.content:encoded:
https://www.gamespot.com/articles/pac-man-game-shutting-down-in-may/1100-6530516/?ftag=CAD-01-10abi2f

GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.

Bandai Namco has announced that Pac-Man on mobile will shut down on May 30, but players can continue playing the game until the closure date.

The shutdown notice came from within the Pac-Man game itself as well as both the Apple App Store and Google Play Store. It stated that in-app purchases will no longer be available after April 1. This version of the game contains the original 8-bit classic arcade experience, as well as original mazes in Story Mode. There are also limited-time themed events that reward players with exclusive skins through Adventure Mode.

It's notable that this version of the game, simply titled Pac-Man with no subtitle or additional branding, is shutting down, as 2025 marks the series' 45th anniversary. However, Bandai Namco is celebrating the anniversary in other ways. Seattle's Museum of Pop Culture is hosting a special Pac-Man display from April 30-June 4, along with a themed event on May 10. From May 18-September 28, the Great Park Gallery in Irvine, California is also going to host a Pac-Man retrospective exhibition.

Club America will also offer limited-run Pac-Man-branded soccer jerseys, and Bandai Namco is partnering up with retailers like Walmart to launch new Pac-Man toys, apparel, and accessories.

Finally, the edgy and dark platformer spin-off, Shadow Labyrinth, is launching on July 18 for PC, PS5, Switch, and Xbox Series X|S.

George Yang on Google+

Got a news tip or want to contact us directly? Email news@gamespot.com

item.title: Pokemon Go April 2025 Events: Raids, Spotlight Hours, Community Day, And More
item.content:encoded:
https://www.gamespot.com/articles/pokemon-go-april-2025-events-raids-spotlight-hours-community-day-and-more/1100-6530402/?ftag=CAD-01-10abi2f

GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.

A new month has arrived, which means a new slate of events to look forward to in Pokemon Go. The mobile game is continuing its Might and Mastery season with a host of activities and Pokemon debuts in April, including the arrival of Paldean Tauros, Mega Audino, and Gigantamax Snorlax.

There are also new raid bosses and Spotlight Pokemon to catch this month, including the rarely seen Ultra Beasts Blacephalon and Stakataka, as well as another chance to get the mythical Pokemon Marshadow. Here's a roundup of all the biggest events happening in Pokemon Go in April 2025.

Table of Contents [hide]

  • April Raid Schedule
    • Five-Star Raids
    • Mega Raids
    • Shadow Raids
    • Max Battles
  • April Spotlight Hours
  • Stunning Styles
    • Wild Pokemon
    • Raids
  • Mega Audino Raid Day
  • Tyrogue Hatch Day
  • Spring Into Spring
    • Wild Pokemon
    • Eggs
  • Sparring Partners Raid Day
  • ???
  • Gigantamax Snorlax Max Battle Day
  • Sweet Discoveries
  • Dynamax Entei Max Battle Weekend
  • April Community Day

April Raid Schedule

Pokemon Go is shaking up its raid rotation once again in April.

The island guardian Tapu Lele is returning to five-star raids until April 9, after which it will be replaced by the Ultra Beasts Blacephalon and Stakataka in the Western and Eastern Hemispheres, respectively. Finally, the legendary Pokemon Cresselia will return to close out the month.

Mega Raids, meanwhile, will rotate through Mega Blaziken, Mega Sceptile, and Mega Mawile, while Shadow Registeel will appear in Shadow Raids every weekend this month. A new batch of Dynamax Pokemon will also appear in Max Battles over the next few weeks.

You can see April's full raid schedule below:

Five-Star Raids

April 1-9

  • Tapu Lele (w/Nature's Madness)

April 9-21

  • Blacephalon (Western Hemisphere)
  • Stakataka (Eastern Hemisphere)

April 21-May 1

  • Cresselia

Mega Raids

April 1-9

  • Mega Blaziken

April 9-21

  • Mega Sceptile

April 21-May 1

  • Mega Mawile

Shadow Raids

Weekends in April

  • Shadow Registeel

Max Battles

April 1-7

  • Squirtle
  • Krabby
  • Chansey
  • Scorbunny
  • Skwovet

April 7-14

  • Caterpie
  • Machop
  • Drilbur
  • Wooloo
  • Falinks

April 14-21

  • Machop
  • Passimian
  • Falinks

April 21-28

  • Squirtle
  • Krabby
  • Chansey
  • Sobble

April 28-May 5

  • Charmander
  • Pidove
  • Cryogonal
  • Wooloo
  • Falinks

April Spotlight Hours

Pokemon Go is hosting more Spotlight Hour events in April, with a new selection of featured Pokemon and bonuses to look forward to this month.

Every Tuesday evening from 6-7 PM local time, one particular species of Pokemon will appear in the wild more frequently than usual, making this a good opportunity to fill out your Pokedex and stock up on candy. You'll also earn an extra bonus during that hour, such as double XP or Stardust for catching Pokemon.

You can see April's full Spotlight Hour schedule below:

April 8

  • Featured Pokemon: Meditite
  • Bonus: 2x transfer candy

April 15

  • Featured Pokemon: Fomantis
  • Bonus: 2x evolution XP

April 22

  • Featured Pokemon: Morelull
  • Bonus: 2x catch Stardust

April 29

  • Featured Pokemon: Abra
  • Bonus: 2x catch XP

Stunning Styles

Pokemon Go is kicking April off with a Stunning Styles event from April 3-7.

As part of the event, the next leg of this season's Might and Mastery Special Research story will be available, with rewards like Kubfu Candy and Golden Razz Berries awaiting players who complete its different tasks.

Another free Special Research story called A Striking Shadow will also be available during the event. Players who complete the story will earn various rewards, including a chance to catch the mythical Pokemon Marshadow.

On top of that, all three variants of Paldean Tauros (Combat Breed, Blaze Breed, and Aqua Breed) will make their Pokemon Go debut. They'll be appearing in the wild and in raids alongside other Pokemon that have different forms, such as Castform, Burmy, and Shellos.

Wild Pokemon

  • Castform
  • Sunny Form Castform
  • Rainy Form Castform
  • Snowy Form Castform
  • Plant Cloak Burmy
  • Sandy Cloak Burmy
  • Trash Cloak Burmy

Raids

One-star

  • West Sea Shellos
  • East Sea Shellos
  • Espurr
  • Rockruff

Three-star

  • Combat Breed Paldean Tauros
  • Blaze Breed Paldean Tauros
  • Aqua Breed Paldean Tauros
  • Decidueye
  • Hisuian Decidueye

Mega Audino Raid Day

Audino's Mega-Evolved form is making its debut this month during a Mega Audino Raid Day on April 5.

From 2-5 PM local time, Mega Audino will appear in Gyms as a Mega Raid boss. Additionally, you'll have an increased chance of encountering a shiny Audino from these raids, and it'll be able to learn a new move: the Charged Attack Moonblast.

As another bonus, Pokemon Go will temporarily increase the number of Remote Raid Passes you can hold to 20, and you'll be able to earn five extra free Raid Passes when you spin the Photo Disc at Gyms. The game will also offer a free Timed Research questline during the event.

Tyrogue Hatch Day

Following Mega Audino Raid Day, Pokemon Go is hosting a Tyrogue Hatch Day event on April 6.

Throughout the event, the fighting Pokemon Tyrogue will be hatching from 2 km eggs more frequently than usual. Not only that, but you'll have increased odds of hatching a shiny Tyrogue as well.

In addition, there will be free and paid Timed Research tasks to complete during the event. A few in-game bonuses will also be available, including double candy for hatching Pokemon and increased odds of getting 2 km eggs from PokeStops.

Spring Into Spring

Pokemon Go is celebrating the changing of seasons with a Spring into Spring event from April 9-14.

As part of the event, the grass Pokemon Gossifleur and its evolved form, Eldegoss, will be available for the first time in Pokemon Go. On top of that, various grass, water, and fire Pokemon will appear in the wild more frequently on different days of the event.

In addition to the featured Pokemon, there will be event-themed Research tasks and Collection Challenges to complete. The game will also offer a few bonuses, including double candy for hatching eggs and increased odds of encountering shiny versions of Remoraid and Fletchling.

Wild Pokemon

  • Remoraid
  • Fletchling
  • Gossifleur

April 9-10

  • Lapras
  • Marill
  • Lotad
  • Ducklett
  • Dewpider

April 11-12

  • Vulpix
  • Ponyta
  • Numel
  • Litleo
  • Hisuian Growlithe

April 13-14

  • Oddish
  • Hoppip
  • Roselia
  • Cherubi
  • Alolan Exeggutor

Eggs

2 km

  • Magby
  • Budew
  • Mantyke

5 km

  • Remoraid
  • Fletchling
  • Gossifleur

Sparring Partners Raid Day

Pokemon Go is hosting a Sparring Partners Raid Day on April 13. More details will be revealed closer to the event.

???

A mystery event is slated to take place April 16-22.

Gigantamax Snorlax Max Battle Day

Gigantamax Snorlax is making its Pokemon Go debut as part of a Max Battle Day on April 19.

Sweet Discoveries

A new event called Sweet Discoveries is set for April 24-29. More details about the event will be announced later this month.

Dynamax Entei Max Battle Weekend

Pokemon Go is hosting another Max Battle Weekend this month, this time featuring the legendary Pokemon Entei. The event is scheduled to run April 26-27.

Pokemon Go is rounding out the month with its April Community Day event, which takes place on Sunday, April 27.

This month's featured Pokemon is the ice type Vanillite. From 2-5 PM local time, the ice Pokemon will appear in the wild much more frequently than usual, and you'll have increased odds of encountering a shiny Vanillite.

The event also marks an opportunity to learn an exclusive move. Until May 4, any Vanillish that you're able to evolve into Vanilluxe will learn the Charged Attack Avalanche upon evolving. Avalanche boasts 90 power in PVP battles and 85 power in gym/raid battles.

On top of that, there will be an assortment of themed Field and Timed Research tasks to complete during the event, as well as a handful of bonuses to take advantage of. Lure Modules and Incense that you use will last for three hours, and you'll earn triple XP and double candy for catching Pokemon. Trades will also cost 50 percent less Stardust.

Got a news tip or want to contact us directly? Email news@gamespot.com

item.title: Baldur's Gate 3 Mod For Stardew Valley Gets Mistakenly Pulled And Then Restored
item.content:encoded:
https://www.gamespot.com/articles/baldurs-gate-3-mod-for-stardew-valley-gets-mistakenly-pulled-and-then-restored/1100-6530514/?ftag=CAD-01-10abi2f

GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.

The Baldur's Village mod for Stardew Valley, which added Baldur's Gate 3 characters into the farm and life simulator, was a huge hit with fans, and even earned the stamp of approval by Larian Studios CEO Swen Vincke. However, a DMCA takedown notice issued by Wizards of the Coast briefly resulted in the fan mod being taken offline. Wizards has now clarified that the DMCA was a mistake and the mod is officially back up.

"The Baldur's Village DMCA takedown was issued mistakenly--we are sorry about that," Wizards said in a statement (via PC Gamer). "We are in the process of fixing that now so fans and the Stardew community can continue to enjoy this great mod!"

A Nexus Mods spokesperson spoke to PC Gamer when the DMCA was received, saying they were also wondering if it was a mistake. "Hopefully, this is an oversight from WotC, who often use external agencies to hunt down violating content, and they will reverse their decision," they said. "Fingers crossed for Baldur's Village."

The mod makes some of Baldur's Gate 3's main characters into villagers, even giving them their own parts of the map. These include Gale, Shadowheart, Wyll, Karlach, Halsin, and Astarion. Currently, Astarion is the only new neighbor players will be able to romance at this time, but the team has confirmed that Haslin's romance storyline is being worked on.

To get the Baldur's Village mod up and running, players will also need to install the Stardew Modding API (SMAPI), the Stardew Valley Content Patcher, and the Portraiture mod, all of which can be downloaded for free over at Nexus Mods. Once the mod is installed, you don't need to worry about starting a new game, and the mod should seamlessly integrate the new content into existing save files.

For more ways to make the most of your Stardew experience, check out our picks for the best Stardew Valley mods.

Got a news tip or want to contact us directly? Email news@gamespot.com
